page.title: 19Wendover Fair and Circus
page.content: King Edward IVths Royal Charter granted Wendover a fairground to be held on the Manor Waste for two full opening days in May and October of each year. The tradition continues and today's "funfair" includes arcades, the traditional fruit machines, the Big Wheel and roundabouts. The caravans and equipment add gaiety and colour to the High Street. A traditional travelling Circus occasionally visits Ashbrook (Castle Park) on the outskirts of the village, where families can enjoy tumbling clowns, trapeze artists and animal acts. Unfortunately this form of entertainment is fast disappearing.
